issue.title: Improve test guards for downlevel OpenSSL versions
issue.body:
> Despite this passing CI tests on the branch, it has failed when merged to main: https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/oqs-provider/actions/runs/4809818002/jobs/8561583885
> 
> Anyone have any ideas why?

It seems github CI does not run on PRs (but on main) Needs investigation.

The failing test is a CA test that _should_ only run on OpenSSL Master (as it fails expectedly on 3.0 which is tested in github CI). Probably needs an additional execution guard. If none of you has time for this, I'll Look into this when I am back.

_Originally posted by @baentsch in https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/oqs-provider/issues/143#issuecomment-1523873593_

comment.body:
The tests pass up to `sphincssha256128frobust`, CMS tests seem to skip as expected because of 3.0.
I re-run an earlier (previously passing using OpenSSL 3.0) CI run which now also fails, which might point to an issue with an "external" change (liboqs, openssl or docker test-image), see also Alex's analysis https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/oqs-provider/pull/143#issuecomment-1524027127.
The failing sphincsplus test could also point to large signature issues as in https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/oqs-provider/issues/121.

issue.title: Improve test guards for downlevel OpenSSL versions
issue.body:
> Despite this passing CI tests on the branch, it has failed when merged to main: https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/oqs-provider/actions/runs/4809818002/jobs/8561583885
> 
> Anyone have any ideas why?

It seems github CI does not run on PRs (but on main) Needs investigation.

The failing test is a CA test that _should_ only run on OpenSSL Master (as it fails expectedly on 3.0 which is tested in github CI). Probably needs an additional execution guard. If none of you has time for this, I'll Look into this when I am back.

_Originally posted by @baentsch in https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/oqs-provider/issues/143#issuecomment-1523873593_

comment.body:

issue.title: Confusing wording in Code generation wiki page
issue.body:
When enabling algorithms, compilation errors occur when too many are enabled. The wiki page states:
```
If a signature algorithm variant that is disabled by default is to be enabled, simply change the enable value of that variant in oqs-template/generate.yml from false to true, keeping in mind that at most 64 variants can be enabled at a time.
```
However the number of variants appears to be much less than 64. Is the maximum number of variants inclusive of the non-pqc algorithms that ship with openssl? If so I think it would be useful to mention that, and perhaps mention how many pqc variants can be enabled separately.

comment.body: Confirmed. 9 PK algs is a hardcoded limitation in OpenSSL1 that I changed with a PR in OpenSSL3. Hence this limitation does not exist with the oqsprovider.

issue.title: security bits=-1
issue.body:
I have generated a CA and a host certificate, both with sig algo dilithium5. When I start `openssl s_server` with option `-security_debug_verbose` I get:

    Using default temp DH parameters
    Security callback: Certificate chain EE key=, bits=256, security bits=256: yes
    Security callback: Certificate chain CA digest=dilithium5, security bits=-1: no
    error setting certificate
    802BF3F4147F0000:error:0A00018E:SSL routines:SSL_CTX_use_certificate:ca md too weak:ssl/ssl_rsa.c:221

The certs look ok to me. I have tried this with falcon512 and with the branches `main` and `ossl-sigload`. I have straced `openssl` and verified that `oqs-provider` is being loaded. Probably, I am doing something wrong, but I have no idea what. Thanks!

comment.body: With near certainty you are using an old OpenSSL Code base. Full signature provider Support only exists in OpenSSL Master. Please let us know if the failure persists if you're using Master.

issue.title: Confusing wording in Code generation wiki page
issue.body:
When enabling algorithms, compilation errors occur when too many are enabled. The wiki page states:
```
If a signature algorithm variant that is disabled by default is to be enabled, simply change the enable value of that variant in oqs-template/generate.yml from false to true, keeping in mind that at most 64 variants can be enabled at a time.
```
However the number of variants appears to be much less than 64. Is the maximum number of variants inclusive of the non-pqc algorithms that ship with openssl? If so I think it would be useful to mention that, and perhaps mention how many pqc variants can be enabled separately.

comment.body: Okay, I've added a line to the wiki explaining this.

issue.title: Confusing wording in Code generation wiki page
issue.body:
When enabling algorithms, compilation errors occur when too many are enabled. The wiki page states:

If a signature algorithm variant that is disabled by default is to be enabled, simply change the enable value of that variant in oqs-template/generate.yml from false to true, keeping in mind that at most 64 variants can be enabled at a time.

However the number of variants appears to be much less than 64. Is the maximum number of variants inclusive of the non-pqc algorithms that ship with openssl? If so I think it would be useful to mention that, and perhaps mention how many pqc variants can be enabled separately.

issue.title: OQS_SHA2_sha256_inc_init fails with OpenSSL 3.0
issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
`OQS_SHA2_sha256_inc_init` in sha2_ossl.c fails when compiled with OpenSSL 3.0.2: `oqs_sha256()` returns a null pointer.

**To Reproduce**
See https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/oqs-provider/issues/144

Can also be reproduced by compiling with OpenSSL 3.0.2 and running `test_hash` (exists with code 1).
Steps to reproduce the behavior:

```
git clone -b openssl-3.0.2 git://git.openssl.org/openssl.git
cd openssl
./config --prefix=$(echo $(pwd)/../.local) && make && make install_sw
cd ..
git clone https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs.git
cd liboqs
cmake -DCMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX=$(pwd)/../.local -S . -B _build
cmake --build _build && cmake --install _build
test/test_hash
```

**Screenshots**
If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem.

**Environment (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: Ubuntu 22.04
 - OpenSSL version 3.0.2
 - Compiler version used [e.g., clang 14.0.0]
 - Build variables used, see above
 - liboqs version main branch

**Additional context**
Appeared in context of https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/oqs-provider/issues/144

comment.body:
> Alternatively, the changes introduced in #1431 require a call to `OQS_init`, maybe oqs-provider isn't calling this initialization routine?

Thank you for the hint! Indeed, these seem to be missing in oqs-provider. (Changing to `SHA2-256` didn't help there).
I'll double check if this really appears independent of oqs-provider and otherwise close the issue here.

issue.title: OQS_SHA2_sha256_inc_init fails with OpenSSL 3.0
issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
`OQS_SHA2_sha256_inc_init` in sha2_ossl.c fails when compiled with OpenSSL 3.0.2: `oqs_sha256()` returns a null pointer.

**To Reproduce**
See https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/oqs-provider/issues/144

Can also be reproduced by compiling with OpenSSL 3.0.2 and running `test_hash` (exists with code 1).
Steps to reproduce the behavior:

```
git clone -b openssl-3.0.2 git://git.openssl.org/openssl.git
cd openssl
./config --prefix=$(echo $(pwd)/../.local) && make && make install_sw
cd ..
git clone https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs.git
cd liboqs
cmake -DCMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX=$(pwd)/../.local -S . -B _build
cmake --build _build && cmake --install _build
test/test_hash
```

**Screenshots**
If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem.

**Environment (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: Ubuntu 22.04
 - OpenSSL version 3.0.2
 - Compiler version used [e.g., clang 14.0.0]
 - Build variables used, see above
 - liboqs version main branch

**Additional context**
Appeared in context of https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/oqs-provider/issues/144

comment.body: If #1431 landeed, OQS_init must be called by any consumer of liboqs, incl. oqsprovider. Didn't we label it an API breaking change requiring downstream adaptarions?

issue.title: OQS_SHA2_sha256_inc_init fails with OpenSSL 3.0
issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
`OQS_SHA2_sha256_inc_init` in sha2_ossl.c fails when compiled with OpenSSL 3.0.2: `oqs_sha256()` returns a null pointer.

**To Reproduce**
See https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/oqs-provider/issues/144

Can also be reproduced by compiling with OpenSSL 3.0.2 and running `test_hash` (exists with code 1).
Steps to reproduce the behavior:

```
git clone -b openssl-3.0.2 git://git.openssl.org/openssl.git
cd openssl
./config --prefix=$(echo $(pwd)/../.local) && make && make install_sw
cd ..
git clone https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs.git
cd liboqs
cmake -DCMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX=$(pwd)/../.local -S . -B _build
cmake --build _build && cmake --install _build
test/test_hash
```

**Screenshots**
If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem.

**Environment (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: Ubuntu 22.04
 - OpenSSL version 3.0.2
 - Compiler version used [e.g., clang 14.0.0]
 - Build variables used, see above
 - liboqs version main branch

**Additional context**
Appeared in context of https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/oqs-provider/issues/144

comment.body:
Tested it again, and the issue only occurs when OQS_init is missing (as in the downstream projects, not quite sure why it worked with OpensSSL 3.2).
I opened a PR for oqs-provider: https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/oqs-provider/pull/146.
Still needs to be done in [OQS-OpenSSL](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/openssl), [OQS-BoringSSL](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/boringssl), and [OQS-OpenSSH](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/openssh).
